Part.P: Eric W. Olson Site Vice President
U. S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission Attn: Document Control Desk Washington, DC 20555
Subject: Cancellation of Licensee Event Report River Bend Station -Unit 1 Docket No. 50-458 License No. NPF-47

On March 12, 2014, River Bend Station submitted Licensee Event Report (lER) 050-458/2014-002-00, Operations Prohibited by Technical Specification for Reactor Pressure / Temperature Limits. Specifically, that report concerned the operational practice of allowing reactor pressure to.become negative during plant startups with the main steam isolation valves open to the main condenser. Ne~ative pressure is not bounded by Technical Specification 3.4.11,Reactor Coolant System Pressure and Temperature Limits.

A similar event report was submitted on March 4, 2014 by the Perry Nuclear Power Plant. That plant was also cited for having violated their Technical Specifications. In a subsequent letter from A. T. Boland to E. J. Harkness (letter Ml14246A151, dated September 3,2014), NRC concluded that no violation ofTS

Sect.H5: 3.4.11 had actually occurred. The Perry plant has since cancelled that lER.
Sect.P: By virtue of that precedence, River Bend Station hereby cancels lER 050-458 /2014-002-00.
This letter contains no commitments. Please contact Mr. Joey Clark at 225-381-4177 if there are any· questions.
